verses.roman:
tataḥ khe 'dṛśyata girir
nipetuḥ sarvato-diśam
gadā-parigha-nistriṁśa-
musalāḥ sāśma-varṣiṇaḥ

synonyms: tataḥ—thereafter; khe—in the sky; adṛśyata—was visible; giriḥ—a mountain; nipetuḥ—fell down; sarvataḥ-diśam—from all directions; gadā—clubs; parigha—iron bludgeons; nistriṁśa—swords; musalāḥ—maces; sa-aśma—great pieces of stone; varṣiṇaḥ—with a shower of.
translation: Next, a great mountain was visible in the sky, and from all directions hailstones fell, along with lances, clubs, swords, iron bludgeons and great pieces of stone.
